programme.title: Attitude
programme.desc:
Always an active person, Tiffiney Perry continued participating in sports and achieving success after a spinal cord injury in her 20s. Now she and husband Chris support others to enjoy the benefits of sport.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Attitude
programme.desc:
Carlos Biggeman is an award-winning photographer, he's about to publish a book of his work. He was born with Down syndrome, but doesn't see it as a barrier.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Kelly & Ramya
programme.desc:
Kelly MacDonald, Ramya Amuthan and a team of blind and partially sighted contributors share arts, entertainment and lifestyle stories.
Année : 2011

programme.title: The Musical History of Lucas Haneman
programme.desc:
We tell the story of Lucas Haneman, a musician who is blind, and hear the magic he makes with his guitar.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Do The Grind Blind
programme.desc:
AMI's Grant Hardy joins a group of blind and partially sighted youth and young adults on their journey to conquer Vancouver's infamous mountain hike, the Grouse Grind.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Ça me regarde
programme.desc:
(S09EP31) On parle de l'accessibilité sur le marché du travail à travers l'impact des échanges et des rencontres avec d'autres amputés au sein de l'association «Les amputés de guerre».
Année : 2011

programme.title: Level Playing Field
programme.desc:
Learn what it takes to be a Para Triathlete from Canadian National Team members Jon Dunkerly and Jessica Tuomela in Victoria, B.C., and discover Active Together in Peterborough, Ont.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Mind Set Go
programme.desc:
Rick turned to fast food and secret eating as an outlet in the face of his wife's health issues and daughter's anxiety struggles. Will training for a mountain hike help him find the strength to lead his family by example?
Année : 2011

programme.title: Level Playing Field
programme.desc:
Learn what it takes to be a Para Triathlete from Canadian National Team members Jon Dunkerly and Jessica Tuomela in Victoria, B.C., and discover Active Together in Peterborough, Ont.
Année : 2011

programme.title: #IGotThis
programme.desc:
(S04EP05) In this episode: Discovering your place. Life on home dialysis may limit physical access to the world, but doesn't stop one person from sharing their creative flair with others.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Double Tap TV
programme.desc:
(S05EP32) In this episode of Double Tap TV, we talk to HumanWare and Microsoft about their Designed for Surface program, which enhances support for Braille displays on Surface devices.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Mind Your Own Business
programme.desc:
(S01EP07) Two women who are blind run an accessibility consulting company in Kingston, Ontario. They struggle with securing new contracts and are looking for ways to streamline their approach.
Année : 2011

programme.title: Best of Now With Dave Brown
programme.desc:
(S04EP14) Join Dave Brown as he discusses the latest news, entertainment, sports and current events through a disability lens.
Année : 2023

programme.title: Our Community
programme.desc:
(S06EP02) Learn more about Young Carers, who are children under the age of 18 in a care-giving role for a parent, grandparent, sibling or relative with a chronic or life-threatening illness, disability, addiction or mental illness, among others.
Année : 2023

programme.title: Dish With Mary
programme.desc:
(S03EP06) Mary visits Owen Sound, Ont. , to meet Chef Zach Keeshig. A progressive Indigenous chef who specializes in unique dishes inspired by his Ojibway culture.
Année : 2023

programme.desc:

programme.title: You Can't Ask That
programme.desc:

programme.desc:

programme.title: Le fardeau de la preuve
programme.desc:
